title: AAAS: Science Advances: Table of Contents
description: Science Advances: Open access, multidisciplinary science journal.

items.title: A robust expression system reveals distinct gating mechanisms and calmodulin regulation of NaV1.9 channels | Science Advances
items.description: An expression system enables detailed study of NaV1.9 channel gating and its regulation by calmodulin.

items.title: Inactivation of the PHD3-FOXO3 axis blunts the type I interferon response in microglia and ameliorates Alzheimer’s disease progression | Science Advances
items.description: PHD3 inhibition slows down the pathology and behavioral decline of an Alzheimer’s disease mouse model.

items.title: Environmental change and globalization dynamics in Roman Anatolia: Stabilizing an accelerating system | Science Advances
items.description: Analysis of coinage and fossil pollen data reveal how accelerated socioeconomic growth stabilized in Roman Anatolia.

items.title: Coding principles of dopaminergic transmission modes | Science Advances
items.description: Dopaminergic transmission modes, coding principles, and their underlying mechanisms are illuminated.

items.title: Predicting three-component reaction outcomes from ~40,000 miniaturized reactant combinations | Science Advances
items.description: Miniaturized, high-throughput execution of 50,000 multicomponent reactions enables reaction outcome prediction at scale.

items.title: Dual mechanism of inflammation sensing by the hematopoietic progenitor genome | Science Advances
items.description: Leukemia predisposition–linked hematopoietic transcription factors mediate inflammation sensing by a progenitor cell genome.

items.title: Neuronal potassium channel activity triggers initiation of mRNA translation through binding of translation regulators | Science Advances
items.description: Activated Slack potassium channels bind translation regulators to stimulate translation of cortical β-actin mRNA.

items.title: Wound state monitoring by multiplexed, electrochemical, real-time, localized, inflammation-tracking nitric oxide sensor (MERLIN) | Science Advances
items.description: MERLIN allows real-time spatial mapping of the NO across the wound bed, which can be used to provide diagnostic information.

items.title: Reconstructive spectrometer using double-layer disordered metasurfaces | Science Advances
items.description: Double-layer disordered metasurfaces predictably encode visible spectrum into speckle patterns with 1-nm spectral resolution.

items.title: Mitochondrial calcium signaling regulates branched-chain amino acid catabolism in fibrolamellar carcinoma | Science Advances
items.description: Mitochondrial Ca2+ signaling regulates branched-chain amino acid catabolism in an adolescent liver cancer.

items.title: Geography-guided industrial-level upcycling of polyethylene terephthalate plastics through alkaline seawater-based processes | Science Advances
items.description: Geography-guided integration of alkaline seawater hydrolysis and electrolysis upgrades waste PET plastics at an industrial rate.

items.title: Reconfigurable non-Hermitian soliton combs using dissipative couplings and topological windings | Science Advances
items.description: Non-Hermitian dissipative couplings are used in a ring resonator array to generate reconfigurable soliton combs.

items.title: Efficient perovskite solar modules enabled by a UV-stable and high-conductivity hole transport material | Science Advances
items.description: A polymeric and UV-stable hole-transport material enables high-performance air-processed perovskite solar cells and modules.

items.title: Interlayer phononic energy dissipation in the friction of graphene layers | Science Advances
items.description: Experimental evidence for the correlation between nanofriction and atomic vibrations.

items.title: A universal strategy toward two-component organic-inorganic metal halide luminescent glasses and glass-crystal composites | Science Advances
items.description: A universal co-melting strategy broadens the exploration of highly luminescent organic-inorganic metal halide glasses.

items.title: Tumor microenvironment–activated Zn//MnO2 battery for sustained and local electrochemical immunotherapy | Science Advances
items.description: An implantable battery effectively delivers metal ion agonists and activates immune responses.

items.title: Active control of excitonic strong coupling and electroluminescence in electrically driven plasmonic nanocavities | Science Advances
items.description: Active control of atomic-scale light-matter interactions is demonstrated in electrically driven functional plasmonic nanocavities.

items.title: In situ tunable, room-temperature polariton condensation in individual states of a 1D topological lattice | Science Advances
items.description: Exciton-polaritons allow for taking accurate pictures of the wave function of quantum fluids in tunable topological lattices.

items.title: Deciphering linezolid-induced hematologic toxicity: Targeting TOP2A and TOP2B via its primary metabolite PNU142586 | Science Advances
items.description: PNU142586, the major linezolid metabolite, predominantly targets TOP2A and TOP2B, leading to linezolid-induced severe toxicity.

items.title: PIEZO1-mediated calcium signaling reinforces mechanical properties of hair follicle stem cells to promote quiescence | Science Advances
items.description: PIEZO1 senses mechanical forces between epithelial cells and controls stem cell behavior in hair follicles.
